bilateral myringotomy tubes.context: A sample note on bilateral myringotomy tubes

drains fluid.context: Surgery which drains fluid involves a small incision in the eardrum, so that the fluid can be gently removed and a tube can be inserted.

small incision.context: Surgery which drains fluid involves a small incision in the eardrum, so that the fluid can be gently removed and a tube can be inserted.

fluid.context: As soon as the eardrum heals, fluid will reaccumulate.

removed.context: Surgery which drains fluid involves a small incision in the eardrum, so that the fluid can be gently removed and a tube can be inserted.

tube.context: Surgery which drains fluid involves a small incision in the eardrum, so that the fluid can be gently removed and a tube can be inserted.

inserted.context: Surgery which drains fluid involves a small incision in the eardrum, so that the fluid can be gently removed and a tube can be inserted.

myringotomy and tubes.context: The procedure, medically termed a myringotomy and tubes, or tympanostomy and tubes, is performed on children under general anesthesia.

tympanostomy and tubes.context: The procedure, medically termed a myringotomy and tubes, or tympanostomy and tubes, is performed on children under general anesthesia.

general anesthesia.context: The procedure, medically termed a myringotomy and tubes, or tympanostomy and tubes, is performed on children under general anesthesia.

Surgery.context: Surgery is performed on an ambulatory or same day surgery basis.

eardrum incision.context: The need for the tube insertion is because the eardrum incision generally heals very rapidly (within a few days), which is not long enough for the swollen membranes in the middle ear to return to normal.

heals.context: The need for the tube insertion is because the eardrum incision generally heals very rapidly (within a few days), which is not long enough for the swollen membranes in the middle ear to return to normal.

swollen membranes.context: The need for the tube insertion is because the eardrum incision generally heals very rapidly (within a few days), which is not long enough for the swollen membranes in the middle ear to return to normal.

tubes.context: There are many types of tubes, but all tubes serve the same function.

keep the eardrum open.context: They keep the eardrum open, allow air to enter the middle ear space, and permit fluid in the middle ear to drain.

air to enter the middle ear space.context: They keep the eardrum open, allow air to enter the middle ear space, and permit fluid in the middle ear to drain.

fluid in the middle ear to drain.context: They keep the eardrum open, allow air to enter the middle ear space, and permit fluid in the middle ear to drain.

rejected by the ear.context: Most tubes will gradually be rejected by the ear and work their way out of the eardrum.

eardrum seals behind the tube.context: As they come out, the eardrum seals behind the tube.

eardrum does not heal completely.context: Occasionally, the eardrum does not heal completely when the tube comes out.

further surgery.context: The majority of children treated with tubes do not require further surgery.

ear infections.context: Some children are very prone to ear infections and have a tendency to accumulate fluid after each infection.

medical treatment.context: They may have ear infections in the future, but most will clear up with medical treatment.

accumulate fluid.context: Some children are very prone to ear infections and have a tendency to accumulate fluid after each infection.

infection.context: Some children are very prone to ear infections and have a tendency to accumulate fluid after each infection.

physically remove the tube.context: Occasionally the physician has to physically remove the tube from the ear drum.
